title: Ravens-Steelers on SNF to cap Week 18 slate
description: The NFL announced the full final-weekend schedule, with the marquee matchup between the Ravens and Steelers set to take place on "Sunday Night Football" on NBC, with the winner making the playoffs.

title: Purdy 'playing as good as it gets'; 49ers eye 1-seed
description: For the second week in a row, QB Brock Purdy accounted for five touchdowns as the 49ers outlasted the Bears 42-38 in a wild shootout on "Sunday Night Football" to set up a Week 18 showdown with the Seahawks for the NFC's top seed.

title: Kawhi puts up career-high 55 for streaking Clips
description: Kawhi Leonard scored a career-high 55 points as the Clippers extended their winning streak with a victory over the Eastern Conference-leading Pistons.

title: Pats clinch AFC East; Bills' reign ends with loss
description: The Patriots clinched their first division title since 2019 on Sunday, dismantling the Jets behind Drake Maye and then watching the Bills fall to the Eagles.

title: Garrett: Steelers' focus more on me than winning
description: Myles Garrett didn't set the NFL's single-season sacks record Sunday, but he believes the Steelers were more worried about preventing his record than getting the win.

title: Rivers: No regrets, even with Colts 0-3 in return
description: Philip Rivers says he has no regrets about unretiring even though the Colts have gone 0-3 in his starts.

title: LeBron, Luka 'set the tone' as Lakers right ship
description: With the Lakers reeling from a three-game slide, a calf injury to Austin Reaves and an air-it-out team meeting coming into Sunday's game against the Kings, LeBron James and Luka Doncic led a dominant 125-101 win to help right the ship for L.A.

title: Tank talk rubs Raiders wrong way amid latest loss
description: Raiders players' displeasure regarding the talk of tanking hovering over the organization intensified after a 34-10 loss to the Giants on Sunday.

description: Sunday's win marked the fifth for the New Orleans signal-caller in just his eighth game as a starter.

title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (22!), Broncos' D (64!)

title: Despite red zone issues, Jaguars are one win from AFC South title

title: Week 17 winners and losers: Maye, Henry shine in fantasy finals; Gibbs, Lamb disappoint
description: Drake Maye, Derrick Henry and Chase Brown came up big when it mattered most in Week 17, while Jahmyr Gibbs and CeeDee Lamb were among the biggest disappointments.
source: Matt Bowen and Tristan H. Cockcroft

title: 'Thank you Browns': Ravens give shoutout to rival for saving season
